page.title: 01Mortimer's Cross
page.content: This area includes parts of the villages of Shobdon in the W and Kingsland in the SE & their surrounding lands. The River Lugg flows through the area and the land S of the river is low lying quite the level & open. North & W of the river the land rises to form hill slopes. The steeper slopes to the NW are covered with coniferous forests. Is is predominately a fertile, agricultural area, much of the land being used for arable farming. There is also a considerable amount of intensively managed grassland used for grazing and silage. People living & working in the area are mainly concerned with farming. The village of Mortimers' Cross is found in the north of the area and is at the crossroads of the A4110 & the B4362. This is the site of the battle of
